      • AsyncRequestImpl

        public AsyncRequestImpl(AsyncRequest<RESPONSE_TYPE> _asyncRequest,
                        Reactor _targetReactor)
        Create an AsyncRequest and bind it to its target targetReactor.
        Parameters:
        _targetReactor - The targetReactor where this AsyncRequest Objects is passed for processing. The thread owned by this targetReactor will process this AsyncRequest.

      • processAsyncResponse

        public void processAsyncResponse(RESPONSE_TYPE _response)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: AsyncResponseProcessor
        The processAsyncResponse method accepts the response of a request.

        This method need not be thread-safe, as it is always invoked from the same light-weight thread (targetReactor) that passed the AsyncRequest and AsyncResponseProcessor objects.

        Specified by:
        processAsyncResponse in interface AsyncResponseProcessor<RESPONSE_TYPE>
        Parameters:
        _response - The response to a request.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • processAsyncException

        public void processAsyncException(java.lang.Exception _response)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns an exception as a response instead of throwing it. But regardless of how a response is returned, if the response is an exception it is passed to the exception handler of the blades that did the call or doSend on the request.
        Parameters:
        _response - An exception.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setExceptionHandler

        public ExceptionHandler<RESPONSE_TYPE> setExceptionHandler(ExceptionHandler<RESPONSE_TYPE> _exceptionHandler)
        Replace the current ExceptionHandler with another.

        When an event or request message is processed by a targetReactor, the current exception handler is set to null. When a request is sent by a targetReactor, the current exception handler is saved in the outgoing message and restored when the response message is processed.

        Parameters:
        _exceptionHandler - The exception handler to be used now. May be null if the default exception handler is to be used.
        Returns:
        The exception handler that was previously in effect, or null if the default exception handler was in effect.
